text: TAT-3 was the third transatlantic telephone cable, in operation from 1963 to 1986. It had 414 kHz of bandwidth, allowing it to carry 138 telephone circuits (simultaneous calls). It was long, connecting Widemouth Bay in Cornwall, England to Tuckerton, New Jersey in the United States. It was owned by AT&T; and GPO (now BT). It cost £12m in 1960 ==References== Category:AT&T; buildings Category:British Telecom buildings and structures Category:Infrastructure completed in 1963 Category:Science and technology in Cornwall Category:Transatlantic communications cables Category:United Kingdom–United States relations Category:1963 establishments in England Category:1963 establishments in New Jersey Category:1986 disestablishments in England Category:1986 disestablishments in New Jersey
title: TAT-3
